page.title: 04Bawdeswell Agriculture
page.content: Most of the farms in Bawdeswell are farmed by one man on behalf of a Norfolk family who have lived in the county for many generations. Recently the cropping has altered and they now include wheat, barley, oats, kale and sugar beet with field beans on the one small farm still owner occupied. On the larger unit, which extends to a neighbouring parish, a computer has recently been installed to monitor the success of crops, record the yields and progress of the dairy herd and followers, handle the wages and other farm records. The buildings, a collection of old and new, are almost all used for agricultural purposes, only a few cottages are let for holiday use. Shooting & fishing is for the owners only. Wildlife abounds in the scattered woods which are not farmed.
